medical_history.chief_complaint: Breast reconstruction following mastectomy due to breast cancer.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The recipient twin underwent a right mastectomy in 1998 due to stage II breast cancer and initially had tissue expansion with subsequent silicone implant reconstruction. After radiation therapy, the silicone prosthesis became exposed and infected, leading to its removal. The patient had no suitable donor sites available due to her nuliparous status and being an avid runner.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Right mastectomy in 1998 for stage II breast cancer; history of postoperative radiation therapy; initial silicone implant reconstruction, which led to exposure and infection.
medical_history.family_history: Identical twin sister willing to donate tissue for breast reconstruction.
